intro: Spiloxene gracilipes, commonly known as the slender spiloxene, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Spiloxene gracilipes is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
